-
 
I'm putting this here at the start: This is a not a confession asking for advice, I just want a place to post and pour my feelings out. Thanks for listening NUSWhispers. It may also be what some comments deem as 'pathetic', I may trail off and not have a completely 'so what?' conclusion, but if you're still sticking around for this long post thank you for just taking your time to read this. Certain numbers are going to modified in case people I know figure who is it out, but the ratio will be around the same. She's too busy to use NUSWhispers so please don't tag her here.

Yes, it's a romantic confession. And please don't turn it into a debate about medicine, she just happens to be a med student, you can take her as any other stressed uni student and what I say would still apply. 

I have had romantic feelings for a girl for 5 years. Known her for 6years. 

I guess I'm hesitant to use the word 'love' because I believe love to grow out of full mutual understanding AFTER someone has tried out a romantic relationship with the person in question. 

Her looks won't be the most striking thing about her. I've heard most of our mutual friends call her 'pretty' (So objectively she's about 6.5-7/10, hardly a head-turner on the streets) but she's gorgeous to me with all bias intended. During the six years I've known her she has always been the smart one in the group. She worked really hard for A levels and managed to get her dream. I think she's going to be great at it. She was never one of the social butterfly type of girls, but she's a good listener. She's the type of girl who won't be the first to organize an outing for our group of friends, but if someone in the group is facing a crisis she'll hop down no matter what, beer in hand and just sit and listen till 2am even if she has assignments due the next day. And she gives pretty good advice. Not perfect, but she has a knack for reading people. She's not the most cheery person around, but she's someone who turns all her mistakes into motivation and continue working to her goal, and is always encouraging to others. She's extremely driven but still takes time to be a great friend and show compassion, she helped me out a lot during A level revision period, basically went through the entire syllabus of a subject with me when I was getting S for prelims even whilst being behind on schedule for her own H3 revision. 

With all due respect this may sound like I'm viewing her through rose tinted glasses, but I truly believe she is someone who has her life figured out, and is suited for the career she has chosen. So why the confession now? 

Well it just feels that in university she has become more anxious. I'm not sure if it's the drive to be perfect with her peers around her, but she's becoming increasingly stressed. Initially I dismissed it as what all uni students go through, but it goes deeper than that. She has always had high standards for herself, but now she is constantly hard on herself, blaming herself for things that aren't her fault. And remember when I say she uses her mistakes to motivate herself? Well, she's now taken it upon herself that every patient who dies on her (even though she was not in charge of treating them at all) is somehow another driving force behind her having to know absolutely EVERYTHING so that next time she won't harm a patient because of something she didn't know. 

She's getting good grades but the prospect of her grades dropping slightly causes her to shut herself out from our close group of friends and just work. She increasingly feels that she's ugly, stupid and a failure and confides in me from time to time that she feels inadequate next to her med friends where anything less than an A in a posting is something to be ashamed of, when her own parents are telling her it's okay to get B as long as she is happy and healthy. And they are pretty typical asian parents, so even they can see how hard she's been working. 

I really wish I could offer her the same thing, listen to her and make her feel better, but she's always been the mother of our group of friends, and to her we're all her little brothers/sisters and she feels weird burdening us with her problems. In fact it's almost as if she lacks an implicit trust in us to not judge her for seeming 'weaker' than she appears. She trusts us enough to tell us there is a problem, outline it for us, but always ends it with 'but I've dealt with it myself, so there's no need to worry! Now tell me more about...' 

 I like her no matter how insecure she feels but I do miss the old confident girl who would just chill and play Skyrim on the couch next to me instead of curling up into a corner and trying not to cry when she does badly in an assessment. It's not that she's become toxic or distant from all this, not at all, but even amidst more listening and more advice giving as the guys entered uni and faced new problems I can't help but feel that she needs someone to listen to her, for her to stop trying to be so selfless for her friends and stop penting her own feelings up. 

I guess I just feel helpless. I have never made my feelings known to her because I know she sees me as her brother, and she's always been too focused to be dating anyone. I used to be happy that there's no heartbreak involved in her being with another guy but now I just want her to be happy. I know the type of guy she likes, her 2-3 crushes have all been people who made her feel safe, whom she felt could protect her, but I'm unable to make her feel the same way, perhaps because our dynamics have been the same for so long. Even if I can't be the one for her, I'm content to watch over her. I don't need to burden her with the knowledge of my unrequited interest. 

I can't tell her this directly without revealing my feelings, but I guess to all the similar people out there, guy or girl, I want you to know that it's okay to not be perfect, that it's okay to be anxious/cry/mope over this without moving past it too fast, and it's really, honestly okay for you to allow yourself to feel down and vulnerable. To quote her own words 'You should take what life throws at you and do what you can with it, but never be mistaken into thinking that it is wrong to give yourself time for grief, despair or rage. It is because life is too short that we mustn't focus just on happiness. We need time to be simply human.' 

I hope you remember your own words from before university. But it's alright if you don't. I'll be there to listen if you get hurt, I'll be your guardian even if you don't think I can, until you find the person you entrust your safety to. 

Tl;dr I like/love a girl for 5 years, and I just needed to vent about me feeling helpless in her increasing problems and anxiety.

I feel like I have the need to get through to the people reading on this platform. PLEASE be mindful of the things that you have posted online, be it on your privatized Instagram account, Facebook, or even Dayre. Be responsible for the consequences that may arise from what you have posted.

There have been countless times that people post/talk about me on their social platforms, and most of the time I'd brush it off. Recently, I finished 2 of my presentations for a module within the past 2 weeks, and I have noticed how this relatively "Instagram-popular" girl have talked about me on her dayre, dissing me on my behavior and my attitude towards my work, and resorted to calling me a b****. I tried to put it off my mind, but I just can't, for I think she went overboard in shaming me on her blog. Yes, she did not reveal my identity in any way, but she has crossed the line this time round. I know I mentioned how "I don't mind and you don't matter" but do you know I was NOT talking about any of you.

We are already in our final year, please, talk it out with me, deal with me, but never ever post it online and garner agreements and support from your other instagram/dayre-famous friends.

-
 
To all the couples out there, you don't know how lucky you are.

Having been single all my life, trust me, i know what it is like when i say i am lonely. sure, i have tons of friends, a great family, but there is just a hole inside me that can only be filled by a special someone. my significant other.

You have no idea what it feels like to just go to the shopping mall, and see a plethora of happy couples, holding hands, laying in each others arms, while you walk alone, longing for a special someone to hold your hand, to feel the warmth of another person.

What it feels like going to the movies, with a couple sat beside you, the girls head on the guys shoulders, and you're sitting there by yourself, thinking, fantasizing about what it would be like if you had a girlfriend/boyfriend.

When you are done with school, and your friends all have plans to go out with their partner, and you go home to an empty room, and stare at 4 walls. trying to shake off your loneliness, telling yourself that one day, you will get someone.

I am smart, funny, and a 'guai kia'. i don't smoke, don't club, don't fool around. people keep telling me that one day i will find a great girl, but i am still waiting for that day to come.

I know, there are going to be people saying, you only see the good side of relationships, you don't see the quarrels, struggles, fights they go through. but hey, ask any guy who has been single for a long time, having someone is better than having no one at all.

So people in relationships, count yourselves lucky, there are plenty of people out there who long for what you have.

lonelyguy335

I'm noticing that a few well-performing friends are feeling very burnt-out as the semester or candidature ends. Are there any more of you out there? We should find or share good channels to vent or recover before something worse happens to us.

I have no intention of putting anyone down with this post be it those not doing as well or those currently seeking psychiatric help. We need help too.)

The lack of trust, the lack of knowledge of your true status... even your close friends know nothing of who you really are.

But I've hidden so much from my friends.

I don't want to work like an undercover and continue covering up my life in layers of deception. I can seem happy and smile, and am excellent at deflecting attention away when people probe deeply.

I admit, I have been hurt before. But because of that, I've started to protect myself from even friends. I think people can betray me anytime when it is in their interests. Even when sharing secrets, I share just enough to satisfy them, yet not let them be able to cause significant damage with secrets. Often I place the parts in completely different friend groups so that the probability of piecing together my emotional pent-ups is low enough to not expose me.

I don't want to cover up anymore. Yet I don't want to lose my friends.

Tell me how. I don't know.

I just want to be a good person. I want to start my life afresh.

Reference to 

To the OP who mentioned that your bf thinks you're too 'clingy' and so pushes you away. 
I have a bf and our role is quite reversed of yours. Maybe you might find some enlightenment from my point of view (which your bf may be feeling the same too) 

Though im a female, my character tends to gravitate towards a male personality sometimes. 
My bf used to be very clingy to me as well. It's good for couples to bond & spend quality time but its also important to have a balance & to respect each other's space as well. The reason why your bf push you away may be because he realize he needs more space/time as an individual to grow and there are some things he prefer to do alone. He could be someone who enjoys freedom but is too choked by your constant presence. During times when he is not around you, why not find time for urself or for your family and friends? its good to take a break too. 

Spending too much time w your partner may not too healthy anyway. You may find yourself running out of topics eventually. Your world & self may run a risk of being just defined by u and ur partner eventually. (Some people may be fine with that but not everyone is to be defined like tat. Try understanding from this point of view) Have some trials and errors e.g. loosing your grip here and there, maybe he will be running back to you again. Besides, absence do make the heart fonder too! 

It took some time for my bf to loosen his grip abit. I felt much better and closer towards him after that.

People speak of getting together. I'm genuinely happy for them.What I almost never tell people is the pain I am still going through from my breakup one year plus ago. I keep on telling people quite insistently that I am willing to change for them. 

I was rightfully told three things:
1. I need to simplify my thoughts.
2. I need to recover from my pain.
3. I need to start chasing.

I can do all three. I can be more succinct. I can heal emotionally. I can be proactive.

The problem is: I do not even know how to love.

I don't know how to say any sort of sweet nothing; I'm too straightforward. 

If she is pretty, I will say so. If she is sad, I will ask why and find out, but I do not know how and when to place the concern for best effect.

I don't know how to appreciate the fun the common person has. The common finds it fun watching a movie; I find it fun understanding how a movie is created. She finds it fun to play Pokemon; I prefer breaking Pokemon.

I don't know how to understand triviality. She can laugh at a stupid joke, and expect me to laugh at it too. I can laugh, but only because she laughs. She can read a magazine and wow at it, but I will jump straight for a reading material of more value.

She can enjoy music because she likes a singer. I like music that illuminates more than just lyrics or singer, but the context and complex undertones a musical piece brings.

But even these aren't the problem.

I think I am too hurt and numb to even think how to give love to someone who I trust. But the often acrimonious breaks have left me completely devoid of trust. The woulds occasionally re-manifest through seeing her friends who now give me cold stares.

I know I want to love, but I completely lack the energy and skill to do it.

I'm tired. I just want to have a break, but my wounds won't let me.
-
 
My friends and I were talking about the male alpha beta omega theory, and it actually is pretty dam accurate after some contemplation. Basically alpha males are the popular guys, who get a lot of girls attention and admiration, while beta males are the rest of the guys. With a few handful being the omega males, who are usually so socially awkward they draw attention all for the wrong reasons. From our observation, these are the characteristics of these groups:

Alpha: Supposedly loud, confident, and 'jerk' seeming. They are so confident, they are always surrounded by girls, and it usually doesn't matter whether they are truly kind or a good person or not, girls just flock to them. They can usually be seen with different girls at different times, and they make relationship issues seem like a joke, because they have girls lining up for them. They are the cause for bitch fights. Usually in sports ccas.

Beta: The majority, normal, functioning male population. Since they don't have the alpha-ness to command girls' attention, they usually settle for an average girl. Usually nice and understanding to girls, to their own detriment. Being sensitive to a girl's response somehow makes you seem weak, and not as confident, and girls being girls, they can sense it, and thus your alphaness is reduced in their eyes. This is the reason why they say not giving a fuck is the way to succeed with girls, and in life. Sounds ridiculous isn't it? But that's how the world works. Being the majority, normal socially functional male population, most in this group would eventually find their soul mate. And usually this 'soul mate' is someone who they simply settle for subconsciously, and not the ideal girl that they truly want. This is simply because they don't have girls on a silver platter for choice like the alpha males. Beggars can't be choosers, right?

Omega: These group of people, are the one of the most courageous I must say. As they bring the phrase 'Not giving a fuck' to a whole new level. They literally don't care about what others think about them. Either that, or they have an inability to associate with social norms. Personally, I don't have anything against them. I actually have quite a bit of friends who belong to this category. The sad thing is? Well, after getting to know them, they are usually the nicest and intelligent people I have ever met. Yet they are shunned by people, just because they are weird. No girls would ever like them, just because they are weird, or have obscure hobbies, like being an anime otaku or a video game addict for example. In this sense, most girls can be rather superficial, though I understand there can be exceptions. Sadly, all of my omega friends are still single still, so I can't say that I have actually witness an exception before...sorry girls.

I just find it to be so unfair- the people who are seemingly 'jerks', get awarded for their 'confidence', and while people who are really nice, but slightly awkward, get outcast, further perpetuating the idea that they are weird people. After all, how many of you would actually go and make friends with a guy who everyone shuns? 

If you think about it, omega males are actually really confident individuals. Like mentioned earlier, they 'don't give a fuck'. So if girls are really attracted to confidence, like they do to alpha males, why aren't they attracted to omega males? 

The answer? Well, it is because, everyone thinks that the alpha male is cool. That's right. Girls dig alpha male, because everyone thinks the alpha, is alpha. Both omega and alpha exudes confidence, in different ways, but only the way an alpha exudes his confidence is deemed as cool, while the way an omega does is uncool. 

And how do you define cool? What is coolness? Well, it is simply a social construct. EVERYONE THINKS the alpha is cool, therefore, the alpha is cool, and thus he is attractive. ''Oh the guy there has so many friends, he must be someone incredible. My friends were talking about how cool he was just now. How great it would be if I were actually his girlfriend. I would have a cool boyfriend to showoff.'' How many of you girls out there are actually guilty of this train of thought?

Well this post might seem a little sexist, but this was what we came up with during the discussion, and I thought that it has some truth in it. I just want to confirm if our line of thinking is true or not, and that's why I am typing this right now. Personally, I am not a buyer of girls having such a shallow crowd mentality, but the arguments made really made quite a bit of sense coupled with my own experiences. So, thoughts?

I guess things like this happen for a reason.And I thought you were different. Yet again, I'm the disposable friend.

One of the most cruel thing that could happen in a relationship is the promise that your SO will never have to be alone. But overtime you realise, that you have re-learn how to be comfortable with being alone again. In other words, you'll been pulled out of your comfort zone, but gradually left to sink back in again. And he speaks, 'but you've always been an independent girl'. But no, that was me before I knew you. I want someone to rely on, I've been looking for that all these while and I found you. I feel protected, I feel secure, I've never felt happier. Initially you spend every moment with me and though it took me quite awhile to get use to such a constant presence and support in my life, I really enjoyed it. And I finally felt how love is suppose to be like. But as time goes by I become too 'clingy' to you, as you put it, you start to pull away from me. My messages are getting increasingly ignored by you; you've smiled more and looked happier when you are with your gal pals than with me, looking entirely bummed when I appear in front of you when you're having a good time laughing with them; you get easily irritated by me when all I wanted to do was to share my day worth's of happenings with you, rolling your eyes and just chuckle without commenting. Have you gotten tired of me already? You need to know, you were the one who successfully found your way into my heart and my life, but now you just want your 'independent girl' back. You changed me, but now you just want a refund and get the old me back? Or are you planning for an exchange instead? It doesn't work this way. Just what am I suppose to do?

Remember the leaf story? 

Once upon a time, a random wind brought 2 different leaves together. We spent so many happy and memorable times together. As time goes by, I started to fall in love with you, little by little. Whenever, i wished you good night after our late night texting, I will always drop a tear or two. I hope that you will block me soon enough, because I knew that I won't be able to control my feelings for long. "Block me please! Block me please! If not I will fall in love with you!"  

The random wind blows again! And this time round, we are finally gonna be blown far apart. During our short meeting time, I don't remember  breaking any promises. However this time round, I finally couldn't fulfill one single promise. I thought that I brave enough to accept your rejection like a man and stay as a friend. I was so wrong.... the truth is I'm just a coward who tries to put on a brave front only. All those empty big talks....

But then again, although things has to end this way. I never regretted knowing you! You are not as evil as you thought you are. The fact that you didn't shun a ugly duckling like me, proved that you are a really kind girl. 其实我不只是爱上你的美貌，你的好我都爱，你的坏和瑕疵我更爱。If time can be reverse, I will still walk into utown to buy "feng you" for you, send you home even when I'm not feeling well, do it a thousand times, a million times over and over again and I won't complain. Because I don't wanna let the headache torture you and I don't wanna let loneliness touch you. 

This is my last farewell message to you, by the time you read this message I had already unfollow NUSwhispers and embarked on a new journey. 对不起，笨猪没有用，笨猪没有守信用  ,笨猪让你伤心了，忘了笨猪吧。Everything is just a bad dream, everything will be fine once you wake up. 笨猪永远爱你，不是样貌而已，我爱你所有的一切，原谅我吧。

I was heartbroken, but determine to continue my search on somewhere i really belonged to. This semester, I finally found what i was looking for, a group of friends with the same culture and background as me, a place where I thought i belonged to. However, I slowly realized that this is not what i really want, as I am not the person I used to be. I have changed. I have lost my root. I am not ashamed of how I have abandoned my roots, instead I am proud of how I have adapted to the new environment i was given. It is inevitable that the change occurred and this is who I am now. I used to feel really lost and lonely. However, now I realize that home, to me, is everywhere and nowhere. I wasn't lost completely, instead I am someone that can exist everywhere.

Part 4 (Continued from the #palemandiaries)
I could not believe my luck. Whilst I had secretly admired her over the one last year, here is a guy who got the chance to be with her squandering it away by messing around with another girl.
I am gonna destroy him, I thought. I will expose him for what a philandering fool he is and she will thank me. Thank me for saving her from him. Thank me for opening her eyes. And perhaps she will be mine forever.

I needed to find the right time to reveal it to her. The setting must be perfect. I was chickening out. What would her reaction be? Would she even bother to believe me.

I remember the day i tried to tell her what I had seen. I needed to ease her in. I could not be like "hey your boyfriend is cheating.....so screw him and be with me." What am I ? Brad Pitt.

We sat across each other in the science canteen. I started with " Are you still dating that PhD guy ? I mean are you still together ?"
She was like "Yah ..it is pretty good." 
Wow this is going to be hard. I looked into her big soulful eyes and it was almost like shooting a kitten point blank while it was mewing at you.
But I cannot back out. Fortune favors the bold, they say.

" You know I saw him with some other girl behind the central library".
"What do you mean ? " she said as she looked up from her food.
I explained to her what exactly I saw. I could not give her the gory details. As much as I was thinking about myself, I could almost not do this to her. Is this was true unconditional love or infatuation felt like ??

She listened to me, got up and said "You must be happy then, now that my relationship is destroyed. I always knew you wanted me for yourself."

Instead of thanking me, she had turned this against me somehow me. She got up angrily like I had done something.

Two days went on, I tried to message her on the phone or MSN messenger (this is 2005 we are talking about). She had blocked me. Somehow shooting the messenger seemed to have been the best way for her to deal with her anger.

Few months later I got onto a 95 and she was there. She completely ignored me like I did not exist. How would I fix it ? How could I get her back.

Few more months passed, my 4th year had jus started . I asked Joanna about her . Is she still around ?

"Ahh she did not tell you....she graduated end of last sem. needed to get out of uni and start working." 

I think I lost her forever. I did not even get a chance to even express my true feelings for her. All I got was resentment and anger for a crime I did not even commit.

(Keep reading. this will continue for 10 years, involve a phD, a marriage and a divorce, I shall try to post once per day).
-
 
“I thought of all the others who had tried to tie her to the ground and failed. So I resisted showing her the songs and poems I had written, knowing that too much truth can ruin a thing. And if that meant she wasn't entirely mine, what of it? I would be the one she could always return to without fear of recrimination or question. So I did not try to win her and contented myself with playing a beautiful game. But there was always a part of me that hoped for more, and so there was a part of me that was always a fool.”

- Kvothe
The Wise Man’s Fear - Patrick Rothfuss

I am so intensely jealous of people who were allowed to learn music when they were in their teens. I used to learn the piano when I was a young kid, but had to stop due to financial reasons + I lost interest. 

I started being interested in it again when I was in primary 5 and asked to resume my lessons, but the answer from my mum was " No. You are already so busy with schoolwork." I asked again every single year from primary 5 till JC1, and every single year I got the same answer. 

It is only today that I realized what an awful excuse that was. We only get busier as we grow older, so does this mean that I will never ever get to learn the things I'm interested in? I'm not trying to blame my mum here, but I feel that it wasn't the right thing to tell a child, to use lack of time as an excuse not to do things. Furthermore, if the financial burden was her true worry, I would have appreciated it if she had told me the real reason. 

Oh well, that is all in the past, and just want to say: those who had a chance to pursue your interests outside of school, you're so lucky and do cherish what you have! As for me, I have since took the initiative to teach myself piano instead :) (But that doesn't stop me from being envious of those who play well!)

To 

What is the best way to seek revenge against someone who rejected you?

Imagine one day where you find a girlfriend who is better than your previous crush. You will be so glad that she rejected you then. If not, you wouldn't be able to find your current girlfriend.

Better yet, she had broken up with her boyfriend and think of how different it will be if you were her boyfriend instead.

The best way to seek revenge is to make yourself happy.

To the all the groupmates I've had this semester:

Thanks for the eye-opening experience. Never have I been so challenged and have my patience tested to its limit. I've never had to state the obvious multiple times - heck, I've even learnt to stand up for myself and point out what's blatantly wrong. Also, I've definitely learned what it means to have grace under pressure. 

I've had my grammatical skills put to the test. All those nights trying to phrase your disjointed sentences better, correcting every misspelled word, and cutting down all the fluff just to meet page/word limit - thank you for all that. If I didn't work with you people, I don't think I would have been able to finally understand why run-on sentences were bad.

Without you guys, I've never would have forced myself to initiate things; to get shit done. I've certainly learned to be less of a passive member and be more proactive. So thank you for that as well.

So overall, thanks for the experience. It was definitely great working with you folks.

Adios, and I wish you good luck.

Hi OP of , you are not alone :)
I understand how you feel like you are not passionate about anything in life anymore. I was exactly like you, and it lasted for almost 1.5 years. You just don't feel the energy in life, and nothing excites you. I clearly know sleeping whole day won't help, and I will hate myself even more if I continue this way. Like you, I sought many ways to help myself. And after 1.5 years of trying, I'm finally feeling much better, much happier with myself.

My suggestions for you! I hope it helps! :D
(1) Stay away from social media
Try to not look at social media so often. I deleted my Facebook and instagram app, so it is not convenient to check so often anymore. It will just make you feel more and more terrible seeing others' "good life". You have to understand, what ever you see on Instagram or Facebook are all positive stories of people's lives, so you never know what's going on. But disclaimer: I still go on these social media, but just less often! because it's more inconvenient without the apps. 
(2) Be disciplined
Same like you, I tried to save myself from trying many new things. Take different faculty modules, exercise more, take up new interests, etc. But it all failed. Why? I WAS NOT DISCIPLINED TO KEEP TO THE NEW INTERESTS. I didn't give myself chance to get acquainted with the new interest. Try to keep to it! For example, sign up for 8 classes of Dance classes instead of just going for 1, unless you really hate it lol. The friends you meet during these 8 weeks will keep you going for more, and love the activity! Don't be lazy and keep yourself busy. Winter holidays' coming, it will get worse if you have nothing to do. Go take up an internship! Earn some bucks and learn at the same time, better than lying at home feeling useless. There's plenty of internships on talentconnect.
(3) Look at the brighter side of life
Stay positive my friend. You are much luckier than many people. Don't indulge in self pity anymore!

-
 
To , yes it is possible to still be friends. Even good friends.

I fell for a close friend of mine back in JC, and got rejected a couple times over the 2 years. I daresay, aside from my (ex-)girlfriends, she's the only crush and the first girl I ever loved. Eventually, she got together with another guy, but we had a long talk and agree that we should do our best to preserve this close bond that we have.

I'm in my second relationship since then, and we are still close friends. She would still call to wish me happy birthday every year, or to HTHT about life, or simply just to cry after a breakup. We still meet up for lunch/dinner on random days in school, talking about the ups and downs in our relationships, our future career plans, discuss life philosophies, or just gossiping. Sometimes, I will walk her home after dinner because we are so caught up on a certain topic so we just want to keep on talking about it (texting feels different). There could be a semester that we didn't talk to each other at all, but still meet up after finals to catch up about each other's life.

For those who wonder if it affects my relationships, my ex used to get jealous sometimes, but it wasn't a major issue (we broke up over irreconcilable difference over our lifestyles after 2 years). My current girlfriend has close male friends, and thus very understanding of me having close female friends.

So yes, while the initial period after rejection is tough, but after a couple of months it is really about how much you treasure the friendship and how much you effort you are willing to put into maintaining it (and not fall back into it). For me, it turns out that she became the one friend that is a constant in (the past 5 years of) my life. Sometimes we will reminisce about JC times and laugh it off. I would laugh at (after comforting) her when she broke up and state my awesomeness. She would lament about how guilty she was for rejecting me and how afraid she was about losing me as her close friend. It is a wonderful form of companionship that is totally different from the more passionate feelings, the care and concerns that I have for my girlfriend on a daily basis. 

tl;dr. Yes, assuming you are really over it, and treasure the friendship.
-
 
I don't have a father. I am not close with my siblings. I don't have a good relationship with my mother. She often blame/scold me for not caring for the family, not smiling at her, not talking to her, not talking to my siblings, not caring about the cleanliness of the house. She blames me for not spending time with my family and all. 

Why? My friends doesn't use my words against me. My friends understands my stress. My friends dont add on to my stress by scolding me. My friends talk to me without the conversation leading to and argument. 

Sometimes I just kept my mouth shut when my mother is scolding because I don't want to further aggravate her. However, she takes it as a sign of disrespect, saying that I don't want her at home because her presence at home makes everyone unhappy. She will say how I prefer to spend time with my friends and how we are better off when she is not at home, etc. 

I never said that. I never ever not want her to be home. I just don't like the fact that any conversation that we have will eventually lead to an argument and sometimes (most of the time) I dont even know how it escalated so quickly. 

I don't want to hurt my mother. She is my everything. But I just can't meet her expectations. I can't be her perfect child. I can't. Sometimes I just want to run. Run away from everything. Sometimes, I wonder if my family will be happier without me. Since I don't care about the family, my presence doesn't make a difference anyway. 
-
 
I just fell out of a relationship of almost 4 years at the start of the year. We were each other's first love. I thought I would have taken forever to get over it. 

The first few months were definitely terrible. For 3 months, I could not help but cry every time i think about it and cry myself to sleep every night. I had trouble concentrating in class whenever my brain chose to think about it again.

The 3 months that followed was better... I started to focus on other things like finals and was kept busy with important things during summer. I thought i was really getting over this.

Everything was fine until July when we met up again. I was conflicted because... i thought i was doing so well but all i really wanted to do was  to give it another shot. But the feeling wasn't mutual.

So after that i was renewed with determination and somehow magically i got much much better. Maybe i finally came to terms with the fact that there is no longer any hope in this relationship.

You'd always hope that it is just you overthinking and things weren't really that bad. That love can conquer all. Only after the relationship do you realise how blinded you were and how many ways the relationship was actually going wrong, and how it was built on unhealthy grounds.

Fast forward to now, i find myself opening up my heart again, although i still find it super scary to be so vulnerable and exposed once more. After all, it took a year or so to completely break down all the walls in the previous relationship. It is still pretty unimaginable to let someone in again, to the deepest corners of your heart and soul, and to potentially be crushed again.

I think I've found someone i am willing to open up to... but i can't help but be terribly afraid. I guess love is always a risk, ya?

I don't know if anyone would be able to relate to this but i just wanted to share this somewhere. No matter what each of you are facing, I wish all the happiness to everyone in the world. :)

hi seeing all these relationship confessions has somewhat urged me to do one....

"Oh sorry, I only saw you as my best friend," 

Yea... I cried that night. I couldn't stop thinking about how stupid I was to confess. 

Fast forward one year I am in a loving, harmonious, exciting relationship with my current girlfriend. I honestly didn't know perfection existed until she came into my life. I sound like I'm bragging right? 

But seriously to those people who have been rejected by their crush. I am telling you, don't let it beat you up, sometimes it's not your fault, there are times when two puzzle pieces just won't and will never be able to fit together. So stop being so harsh on yourself. Moving on is actually quite easy if you BELIVE it is. 

Pain is inevitable but suffering is optional. Sooo cheer up guys !!! and it's actually true there will be someone out there who are 10x better than your crush and will give you the love you rightly deserve so persevere!!!

To  OP: I've had my fair share of (inappropriate) crushes too. Some in the workforce. And I always dread lunchtimes or even toilet breaks when the chances of meeting my crushes would appear, afraid that I might flush or look loserish. Yet at the same time I want them to notice me. It eats me up to be so self conscious and wary of my environment. At times, I will take note of what time they come in, sometimes even stalking their public profile online. My only advice is to nitpick on your crush's character or personality, and associate him with a trait that you dislike in a partner. Whenever you think about him, you will remember an attribute that turns you off. It has worked for me (temporarily). It could help you too.

I scoff every time. I try to remind her of the times he has played with her feelings, how he has the tendency to exaggerate about his past and his experiences, I tried telling her that he isn't safe, stable nor worth her time.

I just offer her a supportive smile. What else could I do?

In October 2011, my then girlfriend sent me a message on Facebook. We had plenty of argues initially but over time, she somehow fell for me. We met for the first time and after a few meetings, we got together in November. Things went pretty well: we spent meaningful times together dating, hugging and occasional kissing with what limited time we had. My mum imposed a curfew on me. 
Like any other relationship, we also bickered over who was right and wrong over many matters, but we always got back together.

In the second year, shit happened. I found out that she got to know a guy friend through her CCA from another school. She sent him hugs and kisses through her Facebook messages, which she brushed off saying she "confused me and him". Unbelievable isn't it? However, i decided to let the matter rest and carry on with our relationship. 
I have to admit i too was communicating with other girls behind her back, but it never went to the extent of her sending heart shaped emojis and kisses to someone she hardly knew. 
Long story cut short, things went turbulent and we broke up in 2013.

Two years later today, i found out that three chats in her Facebook messenger in 2011 had plenty of sex related stuff with guys she have not even met in real life. She even asked a guy to strip her, finger her and much more. I'm at a total loss, i wanted to kill myself for doting so much on a girl like her. What should I do? Confront her? To 
Did you talk to her recently about her love life? Some people just don't like to announce their relationship status changes but wouldn't mind sharing if their friends asked (Admittedly, I'm one of them). It's also the reason why my friends keep asking me about my love life on a regular basis to keep up with the news.  In fact, instead of being angry at me for keeping secrets or accusing me of 不够朋友, they were happy that I got attached/got out of an unhappy relationship (even though the news was already 4 months old). So instead of being angry over small matters, why not take things with a bigger heart? Understand that being good or even close friends does not imply that they must tell you everything even their secrets (they may not even see it as secrets) but rather, you know them well enough to know their preferences and habits. Of course, if you asked and she lied to you.... then it's another story altogether. Or if she tells everyone else but you (self-initiated without external factors like probings).

To , yeah I've been rejected before but I still remained friends with my crush. 

What happened was after 3 months or so of chatting I found that I really really liked him, and I confessed, knowing that he probably didn't feel the same way (I hoped, of course). Obviously I got rejected, but we still continued talking, although I felt miserable every day but I couldn't help but want to chat with him all the time. 

Gradually we grew closer, although there were the periodic confessions from me and the continuous rejections from him. As a result I tried to distance myself from him, but I always ended up giving in, which made me feel useless and pathetic. He kept claiming I was one of his best friends, but I didn't feel that he treated me that way. 

We had a huge falling out eventually over that, over my insecurity and his pride. Getting close again after that was a very long and prickly process, but in the end it was worth it. 

Because we're together now :p

-
 
, if you want to know the other person better, you could start by texting him some interesting things/ things that you 2 could relate to, or have sort of talked about before (e.g. real funny or relatable memes). I think from the person's reply you can gauge if he also wants to know more about you. If he's also interested to know more about you, his replies will tend to be a more open-ended one instead of a convo ender. But that being said, you have to initiate the correct kind of convo that can be maintained. I would say start small, to avoid giving the wrong signal, & ALL THE BEST.

 I am currently in this situation myself. If there is still a glimmer of hope, go try for it. Even if she finds someone else eventually, you have one more friend. -
 
I've been with my current girlfriend for 7 years now and I always receive comments like "Wah! How you last so long?" or "You not tired/bored of her yet?" and I am always incredibly incredulous towards their thinking. There isn't really much of a secret formula towards being in a long and lasting relationship - love, commitment, constant effort - but what cause many relationships to fail is not the unawareness of what is necessary, but rather the fact that either/both party fail to deliver it after awhile. It gets tiring to put in constant effort day in day out with the same person when there are so many "better" girls/guys out there, but if she is the right person it shouldn't be difficult at all because all you really want is to constantly make her the happiest she can be.

One other belief I hold true is that if it is something that you feel the need to hide from your SO, then you shouldn't be doing it. You should be able to tell him/her everything and if its something you can't or that you have to delete away then maybe you should consider if what you're doing is right/harmful to the relationship.

As the saying goes: falling in love is easy, staying in love is hard. Personally, I feel that there isn't a need to constantly be on the search for your SO as true love will come looking for you. All the best to everyone be it for matters of the heart or for finals :-)

Tldr: i need advice whether or not i should continue pursuing my crush after initial signs were not good. 

Ok so here's my situation (dont worry this is not some "first letter of every sentence" bullshit)

I had a huge crush on a girl in one of my modules. Every lecture throughout the semester i would sit diagonally up from her so i could steal glances at her. But the problem is that she's always with her friends, which makes it difficult to approach her. Plus being an introverted and shy guy did not make things easier. 

Our last lecture for the semester was on tuesday and i was hoping to God that perhaps somehow all her friends would pon lecture and she would be sitting alone, but obviously to no avail. As the lecture ended i watched with a sinking feeling as she climbed the stairs up to the exit at the top of the LT, passing me on the way up and not even glancing in my direction as she was busy with her friends. I knew  that  that was probably the final time i would be able to see her  as she's not from my faculty (i'm from engineering doing an arts mod and her t-shirt says FASS). A short while later, and with a heavy heart, i made my way out of the LT. I did consider for a brief moment whether i should follow her and see where she goes, but changed my mind. 

On Thursday, I was at Utown bus stop waiting for D2 when by some stroke of luck i saw her there, alone! I knew very well that that would be my last chance to get to know her. It was now or never. My heart was beating like a jackhammer on steriods as i approached her. "Hi you're doing xx1234 as well right?" I asked, trying my best to hide my nervousness and putting on the best smile i could muster. 

We made some small talk while waiting for the bus. I asked typical questions like how do you find the module xx1234, where are you heading to etc. Turned out that she, like me, was going to science faculty. She was going to the library while i had a lecture. 

It was all going pretty well. The only thing that bothered me was that she hardly asked me any questions. I was the one doing all the questioning. But at least her responses were not one worded. Maybe she could sinply just be shy?

When the bus came, we boarded and continued our talk. I asked if we could swap numbers and she said sure. When we reached science we parted ways and needless to say for the rest of the day I couldn't stop thinking about her and the conversation we had, though i had this niggling feeling that she wasnt interested due to her lack of asking me anything about myself. 

That night, i texted her to say hi and she didnt reply till the next day, despite her "last seen" status showing that she did go online at night. I asked if she wanted to study together for that mod today (Friday), but she said she's busy. The conversation ended there as I didn't want to disturb her. 

I really don't know what to make of this (i'm an evergreen guy so i'm not good at reading girls' body language). I keep thinking that i'm only bothering her with my whatsapp messages. But perhaps she was indeed busy considering it's only a week before exams. Should i continue texting her? Or should i just let her go (reluctantly)? Was my approach too hasty? After all i asked for her number like only 10 minutes after getting to know her. For all the experienced guys or girls out there, what do you think? Serious advice only please! I'm quite bothered by this. And lastly thanks for reading this super long post!

Alright. So first off, I have generalised anxiety disorder (was diagnosed with it when I went to psychiatrist last time and am on medication). This means I get anxiety in many situations, including and especially in the social aspect.

I'm in a class with 100 odd people, and these are people I'll see in the next 3 years of my time at university. And I must say, they're quite an outgoing bunch, throwing birthday parties or just get togethers pretty frequently. But me really disliking such social events and being in big groups, I have declined almost every invitation so far. Plus, I'm not particular close to this class, so being at an event where you know people but aren't too close with (or even fond of) them makes it all the more painful for me. 

But I can't help but feel bad at times. Is it rude to always turn down invitations? Since it's a relatively small class where everyone knows each other, I just get the feeling they'd talk about me being really antisocial (I mean I am but I don't wish to be thought of that way in a negative light). I do talk to people in class, but for most of them, I just keep my relationship with them confined to the classroom. And I don't want to disclose my anxiety problem to them either as I feel it's not just a mental issue but also a personal one where I just prefer my 'me time' a lot.

Went cold turkey for probably a month or two. When I saw a friend 'liked' a post, I started reading NUSWhispers again. Interestingly what I immediately did was not so much to read the content of the posts, but the comments. In particular, who the commenters are. To be more precise, if the regular commenters are still around. Even though we never really interacted much, and you may be trying hard to be witty, it feels like an integral part of this place. Familiarity breeds fear of change. As I scrolled down the reverse-chronological news feed, I felt my worst fears coming through, but I persisted and  loaded more posts and finally I see a familiar commenter, then another, and another. Ah, it seems like this place is still the same. But I know that one day, these commenters will eventually graduate from commenting here (happened to many a forums). Never mind, for now (probably at least until the end of the academic year?), it's the same.

I hope everyone who reads this is happy and healthy. If you're wondering whether or not to start catching up on your webcasts/studies, the answer is YES. If you're heart broken, compartmentalise it away at least until your exam is over (sorry I'm not a love guru). Don't forget to check your thumb drives and laptop when moving from place to place. That's all, kohais.

I am a girl who is slightly above average in looks and have attracted quite a fair bit of male attention when I head out to the clubs. We would then start the texting and the typical cycle is that after a week or so the guy would ask me out. 

However after all the initial excitement,  I realised that 90% of the guys ghost me after the first date.  Until now I still don't get it.  I don't think it's my conversation skills as I have quite a lot of friends who enjoy hanging out with me.   Can't really be the looks also as I put on as much makeup as I did when I first met them (so they already had prior warning you know). 

It's not like I was super into these guys but getting ghosted just made me feel lousy about myself.  I started to question what was wrong with me. 

Then I got out this whole cycle and started to meet normal guys who didn't ghost me like that.  I know people would say I was stupid to believe the random strangers from clubs would work out but I had the glimmer of hope in me.  Now I realise perhaps this was a misplaced hope.  Can anyone enlighten me why they are like that?  Why ask me out if they weren't interested in the first place

I have a confession to make. My girlfriend's good friend(let's call her A) and I coincidentally took up the same modules this semester. As a result, we have been attending the same classes together. Needless to say, I ended up spending much more time with A than with my girlfriend (who is working currently). From eating, studying, sitting together in tutorials, doing projects, we are practically doing everything together. To be honest, I really enjoyed her company. Even so, I do update my girlfriend on the stuff I am doing with her and I always make the effort to clear up any insecurities she may have. 
Initially, I did not make much of it as I love my girlfriend a lot and I didn't think much of taking modules with A.

 But after almost spending the semester with A together, I'm getting the feeling that she has somewhat developed some liking towards me. (Btw, my girlfriend doesn't join us for meals and stuff as she graduated a year earlier than me and she's working already.) For example, A recently started writing handcrafted notes for me, saying stuff like "lucky to have you in my life", "loves". I told my girlfriend about the notes but not the content inside it and she told me that A only wrote such notes for her on special occasions such as birthdays. (I have received 2 in 5 weeks already lol). 

Also, I am starting to feel that A is trying to come between me and my girlfriend as she has been texting me stuff to try and sow discord between my girlfriend and I. Her texts to me have been increasingly frequent and bordering on flirtatious. I have been keeping such texts a secret from my girlfriend as I fear her reaction. The problem is that I don't know what to do in such a situation. I feel bad to reveal this to my girlfriend as I don't want her to lose a friend and I still treat her A as my very good friend. 

This situation just became stickier as A just jio-ed me to watch a movie with her this weekend (just the two of us) to "celebrate" going through the end of the semester together. The funny thing was that my girlfriend wasn't invited and neither does she know about this.  A has really become a best friend to me, not just my girlfriend's friend anymore and letting my girlfriend know about this surely would mean the end of our friendship and also A's friendship with my girlfriend. I don't know about my feelings for her but I am certain that given a choice now, I would still choose my girlfriend over A. 

I really don't know how to go about with this, and I know continuing this will only make things so much worse in the long run. Should I maintain the status quo or just tell A to stop flirting with me without letting my gf know about this? Or am I just overthinking and she just treats me as a friend :/

how could you said you love me, when in actual fact, you don't.

when i finally let down my guard to trust someone again and throw away all my insecurities and uncertainties, you had to leave.
you built me up and then i fall apart.

why do you have to make me feel so used to you being around me, then one day, you decided that all these should end.

you left suddenly.

it's like.. i am reading a book and  it ended off with an incomplete sentence. abruptly.

i know i could be just a choice of yours. disposable.
but i tried hard to evade such thoughts, i tried to be positive, i tried to believe your words.
i came up with all sort of irrational excuses to defend your (eccentric) behaviors at times.. thinking that i am the one who is overthinking.

at the end, i am back to square one.
because of this, i felt that, i shouldnt be that optimistic, i shouldnt be so hopeful again.

Never had I thought I would fall for you the day you stepped foot into the tutorial room. I had to admit, you were so vibrant looking that I was attracted to you. Knowing that it's my last semester in school, I plucked up enough courage to speak to you.

"Oh hi, you are an Econs major as well?" Only then through further conversations that I found out you were taking this module alone as an elective.

Coming from a disjointed family, it wasn't easy for me to open up to you but I did. Soon after, we looked out for each other during lectures and we always sat together for tutorials. I looked forward to every tutorial as I miss your cheerful personality and yearn to talk to you on every occasion. Kindred souls, that was what I believe we were, sharing our lives with each other.

Commencement soon happened, I graduated while you continued with your studies. On the surface, it seemed that nothing was different as we still met and spent time together.

"Really??", I thought.

Even the dumbest fool could tell that something had changed, is it you or me?

Half past eleven one night, you broke the news that you found your other half. Time stood still for me, but I would rather it reversed. That day onwards, life wasn't the same anymore. All the things we did that I thought were precious moments to remember turned into painful memories. "Have I done anything wrong to deserve this?", as I kept pondering and pondering.

Work back in office was lacklustre, as I battled my emotions from within. Lingering thoughts in my mind seemed to always break any momentum that I had. Loneliness crept in once again as I began to retreat back into my shell. Every once in a while when I see your pictures with your the other half, a part of me dies. Maybe we shouldn't have met at all, so that I wouldn't be hurt so deep.

Suddenly one night, my phone rang and your number appeared on the screen. After some deliberation, I picked up the phone and said "Hello". You said "Sorry, I found out my other half has been unfaithful to me, I need to talk to you, now." 
Fortunately, I had mentally prepared myself for such scenarios during those sleepless nights and this is what I said.   

"I will like to tell you this phrase from the bottom of (my heart) this post, 1st letter of every sentence." :)

My dad's been taking up a lot of loans just to make ends meet and pay for my school fees and living expenses, and little things like people urging me to change phone or download unnecessary new stuff just irk me :( But then again I don't have the guts to tell them because I may sound defensive to them and that's the last thing that I want :( sigh why am I such a yes man. 

I'm pretty sure the Earth will still revolve around the Sun even if I don't get involved with the latest gadget/software right. #midnightrambling So please guys before telling people off about how they're so not up-to-date, I beseech you to try to keep the comment to yourself. -
 
My parting letter to you. 

Missing someone is painful. Missing a special moment is even worse.

Today was one of those days. 
Did you know I walked by the park that we once roamed? 

The walks that we embarked on, the funny conversations that we shared, the smile you gave me when I told you a joke. The memories and the pang of emotions bounded to it all crashed upon me when my gaze settled on the footpath that we often liked to walk on. 
 
It was not till then, that I finally realised that I have lost you. 
There is this void inside the cavern of my ribcage that can never be filled. Your absence has left a huge gap in my life. 

Waking up to your messages, seeing your smile in the morning, hearing your voice in the afternoon were all something that I have grown accustomed to over the few years of our friendship but now it is just me and the looming reality that you are not here anymore. 
The realisation that I am going to live the rest of my life without you by my side frightened me. 
...So I ended up tearing up at the park. 

Why am I torturing myself like this? Why can't I just move on? 

Isn't this pathetic? Maybe.... but moving isn't an easy task- no sh*t. 
I am not a computer that can instantly erase all of my feelings nor am I a whiteboard that can wipe out all of my memories with one single stroke. 

Even now despite of it being two months since we last talked, I still struggle to feel less empty, now that you're gone.

 Perhaps the most funny thing is that we were never something to begin with. 
You were not my lover or anywhere close to that, you were just my close friend who eventually left my side. 
You said that leaving me was for my best interest. 
I'm not going to say anything to that because cutting ties with me may have been the right thing to do but it may also been the wrong thing to do.
I don't care. My true purpose in writing this isn't to put any blame on anyone. I just want to say thank you. I wasn't able to thank you last time because I was so wrapped up with my feelings and I don't plan to say it to your face any time soon because I know I might return back to square one, so I am going to take this chance to express my feelings so I can achieve the closure that I have been desperately trying to get. 

J. 
Thank you for accompanying me during my final year. Thank you for teaching me and opening my eyes to this big world. Thank you for giving me something to look back to. Even though we are mere strangers now, I will always remember you. 

J. Do I regret befriending you? Do I regret confessing to you? Do I regret getting so close to you knowing that I might get hurt one day?

The answer is no and I don't think that answer will ever change. 
J. I miss you terribly but I am also ready to move on. It has been a pleasant ride with you while it lasted. 
I guess it is finally time for me to wake up from my dream ay?

 thank you for the memories and I admit sometimes I do question myself whether I have fought hard enough for our friendship that night? 
But maybe our story is at the point of no return. We are so apart now that nothing can be done to amend the gap. 
And So it shall.....

Goodbye J, wish you all the best. Stay Gucci. 

Ur S: h.y

<Part 1> 
I met my first bf through a gem module. We got together 6 months later but I wasnt "into" him. I had this feeling that he was not the right one for me even though he treated me very well.
My mum is traditional and stubborn and didnt like him at all. So, I never brought him to my house because my mum dont even want to meet him at all. Because of my mum and some other issues, we broke up, patched up a few times until it was emotionally draining for me.
I initiated the final broke up with him after 3 years because he wasnt the one that I would want to spend my life with.
Yet, I want to thank him for the 3 years standing by me even my mum disapproved him. Btw, we still remain in contact, and he is happily attached!

<part 2>
I met my 2nd bf after I graduated from school for a year. He is 6 years older than me, has stable income and job etc, but he is a male chauvinist. He wanted to settle down the soonest, but I was not mentally prepared to settle down. Again, my mum is traditional and stubborn and didnt like him. My mum felt that he was looking for a wife and rushing through the process. Indeed, I could sense that he didnt love me much. Within a year of relationship, he pressurised me to get married, proposed to live with his parents etc, followed his orders.
I wasnt happy in this relationship. Before he initiated his breakup with me, I couldnt sleep at all for 5 days as I had been thinking alot about this relationship and became ill.
He broke up with me and found a gf after a few months. He married a year after he met his gf. 

<part 3>
I met my 3rd bf through online chatting. He is local, but he was pursuing his further studies in USA when I first got to know him. We chatted everyday and decided to meet in Singapore after 6 months of online chatting. It is kinda risky for girls to meet random guys through online chatting. But he was sincere to fly back to meet me and of course visit his parents in Singapore. Everything went smoothly, and we entered into a long dist relationship. I hesitated alot before I agreed to enter into this relationship because he could only complete his studies in 2.5 years. He promised to fly back 3-4 times a year just to accompany me for 1-2 weeks in Singapore because he was a busy man and had to complete his studies and do research etc. It was a tough time for me because I need to be independent in various aspects. It was tough for him to take 25 hours of flight and overcome jetlag etc, just to accompany me. We also skyped every weekend.
Finally, he came back in mid of 2015 and starts his career in Singapore. Having a long dist relationship is different from the "normal" relationship. We have to learn to accommodate each other, get used to seeing each other every weekend etc.

Break up is part and parcel of my life because needs and wants change at different stage of my life. I grow and learn alot throughout my 3 relationships. 
This is my love story. How about yours?

Obviously the more embarrassing part was that I was in my slutty clubbing clothes and with one of the guy's arms around me.   I almost wanted to find a hole to hide myself.  Professional image gone. 

Now I am more wary.   What if it was my boyfriend's friend instead?  Maybe the moral of the story is not to take photos.  The less evidence the better.

can someone wake me up?
i know i am doing it all wrongly,
i know i am constantly lying to myself.
i know this shouldnt be the way to treat myself,
exposing myself to further damages.

i know what i am in for,
i know i shouldnt.
i know all the logical aspects to it,
but my heart does the call.
my heart erases all the logical decisions that my brain told me to do.
my heart told me otherwise, it told me to do things that are "irrational", my heart and mind are fighting with each other with opposing thoughts.

"you should treat yourself better", the voice in my head said.
"you should hold on longer, maybe better things are arriving", my heart told me.

love has no logic, so most people end up following their heart.
of course, it doesnt mean that those who follows their head don't love that someone at all.
is it because they dont love that someone strong enough? or their determination is not strong enough? or they love themselves more than that special someone?
or they are just doing justice for themselves because if they dont help themselves, then who else will?

but, who is there to help me?
which route to take.

my mind told me: 
"you should know that he isnt serious about you and you have tons of evidences to prove it. he is just treating you as a "spare". he wants you only when he needs you, and he needs you not because he loves you.
you should know love isnt this way. you know he wants your body over your heart. 
he isnt suitable for you. he is constantly destroying you, internally. 
he ditched you the moment he found someone else to replace, but still tries to keep you by his side so that you can always be there when he needs you. but he wont be there whenever you need him. 
you wont have him wholeheartedly, because in his mind, there is someone better, someone whom he wants, not he needs.
simply put, you are there because he has yet found someone to replace you entirely, or maybe he wants more choices to choose from.
stop being silly, stop giving yourself ridiculous excuses to explain his weird behaviour.
you know the outcome, you know the consequences, you know how much tears you have shed and that's enough.
some people arent as good as you imagined, some people exist in your life to destroy you and you should defend yourself."

my heart told me:
"even there is 99% chance that he is a jerk, there is still 1% that he may be serious in me.
if he is really serious about me but i decide to let go first, then i will regret in the future. 
probably he needs more time to think through, probably all this will shed light soon. 
it is okay to get hurt, so hang on. 
you might see the rainbow after the rain."

how?

It's been quite a while, but I keep getting reminded of this these days. 

"When someone's been gone a long time, at first you save up all the things you want to tell them. You try to keep track of everything in your head. But it's like trying to hold on to a fistful of sand: all the little bits drip out of your hands, and then you're just clutching air and grit. That's why you can't save it all up like that.

Because by the time you finally see each other, you're catching up only on the big things, because it's too much bother to tell about the little things. But the little things are what make up life." 
From Jenny Han's To All the Boys I've Loved Before

Anyone feel the same way about relationships with family, friends and love?

I'm a lucky person. I've sailed through life so far, I'm graduating soon from medicine, I have my own car and live in a nice house and never needed to work or want for material things. I'm beautiful enough that I'm tired of the boys throwing themselves at me. 

But. I can't hold a conversation with my mum without it ending in screaming fights. My siblings are spoiled and seem determined to fail every exam. I don't like any of my relatives.

My dad died when I was 21. I was his favourite child. He drove me everywhere and doted on me the most. He gave me the choicest bits of chicken and cracked my crab and deboned my fish and peeled me grapes; a language of love expressed in food. He brought me to tuition, to school, on shopping trips. I never got to say goodbye to him. I still can't seem to get over it. I can't bring myself to tell anyone.

I'm so, so jealous of all the other normal students who are merely worried about grades and BGR. It makes me want to scream sometimes, the triviality. I would trade everything to get him back. Was I not good enough? Was I not pretty and clever and witty and charming at his company parties and family reunions, the perfect child to show off? Did I not do him proud? 

(tell me why you didnt love me enough to stay)

I'm still bitter that he won't be coming to my graduation.

To all the people trying to find someone to date, and feeling crazy. You know, it's not easy to get someone to love you. The only way possible is to make yourself lovely. I have no idea how to do it, though there is an entire industry devoted to this matter.

However, there are definite ways of how not to. Meet, Eliot Rodger. A frustrated virgin dickhead who shot up a sorority house in University of California, Santa Barbara. Luckily for us, he wrote down his manifesto, and some poor souls turned it to a 10 hours long audiobook. 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rT52PqQ8_kU

I know it's kinda long, but I use it as a white noise generator while I'm working. And you might ask why I am propagating the message of a killer. In the same way that you would read Mein Kampf. First, it's a guide of how-not-to. Second, give this to your friend, see his reaction and whether he agrees or not. If he does, well, that's someone you should stay a bit away from. Third, I might face criticism as this can serve as a "trigger", or "initiator" or other copy cats, but look, if there are really such people, they would have gone insane and some point; better to spot them earlier than later.
-

How to recover from this? I don't know.

-
 
We met on one of those apps. I had the vague inkling that it wasn't going to last, but you know, hope springs eternal and all that. First came the usual pleasantries - desserts, long texts, how's-your-day - amazing how small little things like that still made me so happy. You used to ask me to come out to meet every other day - just because you wanted to see me.

Slowly, the texts decreased, and the interval for an reply stretched from minutes to hours. We met once a week, then once every fortnight, then hardly at all. Scheduled dates became hurried texts late in the evening asking to hang. Busy, you said, in explanation for why you took days to reply a simple question. Work, family, friends - they all demand a lot of time.

After we talked about priorities and respecting each other's time, things improved for one week. The next week, total radio silence.

And so we went on for a month, trudging through this sad, undefined, half-dead unlabelled relationship. It's been four months in total, and not once have I been introduced to your friends, nor had my hand held in broad daylight. The latest explanation for standing me up? No apologies, but just a blanket 'was busy'.

Enough is enough. To those lovelorn folks out there, hope on but remember, you get the love you think you deserve. Today I lost someone whom I thought would be worth the care I could give, but in return, I regained self-respect. No one deserves to be the call girl or the back-up plan at the other party's convenience and precious time. Remember - you deserve to be worth the effort :)

TL;DR: You deserve to be with someone who treats you like you are worth a damn. And maybe I'm pathetic and stupid for holding on so long.

Hi, everyone at NUS. Just wanted to say thanks. 
I'm an international student who arrived here in late July. As a student from a country where Singapore is not such a popular study-abroad destination (no offence, not so many people manage to get in, that's why.), I was scared at first. I was terrified of not being able to get along; I couldn't understand half the things my friends were saying, and they couldn't really understand me either. But now I think I'm getting the hang of it. Not perfect = not even close! - but getting their slowly. Now I find myself using Singlish from time to time, loving the food, and even sharing some values that my friends consider important. I whatsapp like my friends now, too! It was all possible because everyone welcomed me with such warm smiles and gestures. Not just my close friends, but everyone I came across at NUS. Most of the time, my expectations are never met but NUS is beyond my expectations (getting cheesy!), I'm thrilled to come back in January for the next 7++ semesters here.
Oh and yes, I'm coming back, still got people asking me if I'm an exchange student. (after all those classes we've had together!)
Yup, so... nothing special, just wanted to say thanks to everyone who helped me get along. A <i>huge</i> thanks. ;)

But 6 months ago, a close friend of mine got close to him through me. She teases and touches him whenever she has the chance.

In fact, I felt that she was seducing my close guy friend and throwing me aside. I tried to shake it off by telling myself that I may be overly sensitive and tried my best to mend the friendship between her and I. 

However, recently during one of a group gathering - she started it again! Almost everyone thought why is she suddenly so close to the guy! And asked if they are dating or something?! When it happened, I thought 'omg, this can't be happening again??!!' 
First, you blame and deny that you have any intention of seducing my guy close friend. Then, you put the blame on me for being too close with him. Now, with everyone's judgement from that day, I think it's safe to say I wasn't too sensitive about what happened previously.

I'm feeling so upset and affected by it. It feels as though I am losing two friends in one go! And I feel like I am being betrayed emotionally by her.

I'm a few weeks away from leaving NUS and here's a small piece of advice for my fellow students who still have some way to go. When things get tough, step outside and look up at the night sky. Put things into perspective. Grades and results are not everything. Trust me, I know because I've gotten every single grade from A+ to F. Try new things, meet new people, everyone has a story. That is what made my time in NUS memorable. 

I happened to be in close proximity to 2 suicide attempts during my time in NUS. One was unsuccessful, the other one unfortunately was. Just remember, things always work out in the end, even if they seem hopeless at present. Take a deep breath and look up at the stars. All the best my friends.

To OP, i know some of the signals can be very misleading. He might be acting as such because you are best friends with each other and he feels comfortable acting all touchy with you. But then again, he might just be talking about girls in a group to "fit in" to an all guys group. Don't take it as he is interested in you first. What i will do is, the next time he does those actions again, i'll do the same actions back to him or casually say gay statements like "eh, don't fall in love with me leh" something along these lines.  :) Whatever you do, don't just come out to him. The risks involved are too much. Or maybe the next time when there are girls in the group, just casually take note of his body language with the girls maybe? Hope it helps!

-
 
Looking at NUS posts, sometimes I wonder why some people constantly look for dates, bf and gf. I have seen some of my friends going in and out of relationship, some desperately searching for one. To them, relationship has became a need instead of want. I understood, I have been there too. The constant need of someone to love you and it gets even more unbearable when the person you love most leaves you. But now I realized; in the search I have became foolish, desperate and disappointed. I have love all along. I have my family and when there is a need, I have my second family. My friends. We meet every week in one of our houses and we share our problems, play, buy gifts, go out etc. Things that you would do with your date, albeit minus the intimacy. We do the lovey-dovey style too, saying babe, praising, 'confessing' how much we love each other. I think that itself is beautiful enough. No need for commitment but still we took care of each other. No need for disappointment but still we argue and scold one another. For now, I will stop looking for dates. Until someone comes along, I am already attached to my second family.

I'm willing to bet most of us are tired of seeing posts about introverts using their introversion as an excuse for not functioning well in project groups, for having crappy resumes, for not putting their best foot forward to pursue their goals, because somehow or rather it is linked to their being shy and awkward around people.

As someone who also identifies as far more introverted than otherwise, I wish people would stop confusing introversion with being shy and being an awkward wreck in social situations, and more importantly, to stop using introversion as a crutch.

To OP of 

Hi OP, i know the feeling of loneliness, at times it is alright, at times it will just hit you at your face. At least for me, when that happen, i will go online and research on things like "should i come out to my friend" etc and the most common advice that i will see is "if they mind, they are not really your friends". Truth to be told, it is not really that simple. We treasure the friendships so much that we are not willing to risk it even though we really want to tell them as we are tired of pretending and we really want them to know the real us. It's not easy to make a decision whether to come out or not. I could share with you my experiences if you want :) But what i would like to share for now,  the safest route would be to tell your closest friend that you have known the longest and is the most comfortable around with. Try to build up experience so that you will not be afraid to come out to people. Up to now, i have received no negative reactions from people although many of them were shocked.

Well, i could be that buddy that you can share your feelings with. I surf nuswhispers every now and then. I don't know if the admin does the "leave contact with me" kind of thing but if you need someone to talk to, just submit a confession :) i'll do my best to reply to you here :)
